Makefile is a UNiX- specific utility

make file variables — there are some that are specially named used by the makefile in special ways (e.g. CFLAGS)

CC — compiler
  • cc = gcc

INCLUDES — a nice way to specify anything else you need for invoking other flags
  • CFLAGS = -g -Wall $(INCLUDES) 
  • Only use relative flags in assignments.

CFLAGS — 
  • when compiling, using these flags 

implicit rules 

LDFLAGS
  • Link flags

LDLIBS
  • For linking libraries


core files only occur when an error comes up



Explicit rules:
- the implicit rule only runs when there are no commands under the target and the dependencies
- As soon as a tab 


You can add more dependencies so that you can use both implicit and explicit rules.


.PHONY ensures that Unix knows that it isn’t specifying a file. (e.g. in case clean is a file)

Make will check timestamps for files 





git ls-files
find which files are being tracked 


git checkout <Hash> <file_name>
git checkout HEAD


git format-patch —stdout origin > mywork.mbox

git rm —cached <filename>
